job_description: Sr. Business Analysis Manager - job post Kite Pharma 59 reviews Santa Monica, CA $146,200 - $189,200 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $146,200 - $189,200 a year Job Type Full-time Job Description At Gilead we believe every employee deserves a great leader. As a people leader now or in the future, we expect that you will model and create an environment of inclusion, be intentionally focused on the hiring, development, growth and retention of talent, and empower teams to align and achieve goals. Job Description Sr. Business Analysis Manager, R D IT We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join us as a Sr. Business Analysis Manager, R D IT. You will work with the Information Technology team in supporting our efforts in this exciting new area of cell therapy. This role will work closely with the Medical Affairs functions to deliver technology solutions that meet our critical business needs. This important role requires relationship management, business analysis, and project management skills as well as hands-on technical knowledge for various solutions such as External Scientific Collaboration Management, OL Engagement, Real World Data and their applications in Clinical Development, and among others. Key Accountabilities: Serves as functional resource and subject matter specialist for Medical Affairs Information Management Systems Collects, documents, and manages user, functional, and technical requirements for Medical information management systems for the Cell Therapy business areas Interacts with end users on a regular basis to understand their needs and provide guidance and training on technical solutions Makes recommendations on business process automation and improvement with digital technologies Participates in system release and post-deployment support activities with Quality, System Owners, IT Security, IT Operations, and IT Service Desk Manages application configuration changes following IT Change Management (ITCM) and GxP Change Control procedures Provides day to day application support with managed service teams Troubleshoots technical issues and manages problems through to resolution Develops processes to ensure high availability of supported application systems Documents common resolutions/solutions and application support processes in the IT Service Management knowledgebase Basic Qualifications: PhD degree in Computer/Engineering or equivalent and 1+ years of IT solution development experience in industry OR Master’s degree preferably in Computer/Engineering or equivalent and 6+ years of IT solution development experience in Industry OR Bachelor’s degree preferably in in Computer/Engineering or equivalent and 10+ years of IT solution development experience in Industry Preferred Qualifications: At least 5 years of experience working with medical affairs information systems Deep understanding of the late stage clinical development and commercialization lifecycle with specific focus on Medical Affairs business domain/technologies enabling core functions such as external scientific collaboration direction, Real World Data and their applications in clinical development as well as broad medical inquiry management, and field medical affairs Broad clinical development business and IT capability awareness and hands on experience including global implementation experience with Veeva, Salesforce, iEnvision / Datavision, real world data integration and related analytics, medical platform-based solutions Deep understanding of security and privacy regulations, GDPR, internal/external Audits and CAPA management and anticipate future technology need Must possess excellent customer service, problem solving, troubleshooting, and verbal/written communication skills Work experience and meaningful knowledge of end-to-end IT software and systems solution delivery from idea conception, design, development and/or configuration, and transition into production support and maintenance Computer System Validation (CSV), and GAMP5 experience a plus Thorough focus on process, continuous process improvement and quality to enable innovation Demonstrated achievement of working in Agile (e.g. SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and DevOps ways of working in the IT landscape Does this sound like you? If so, please apply today! The salary range for this position is: $146,200.00 - $189,200.00. Gilead considers a variety of factors when determining base compensation, including experience, qualifications, and geographic location. These considerations mean actual compensation will vary. This position may also be eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, discretionary stock-based long-term incentives (eligibility may vary based on role), paid time off, and a benefits package. Benefits include company-sponsored medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans*. For additional benefits information, visit: https://www.gilead.com/careers/compensation-benefits-and-wellbeing Eligible employees may participate in benefit plans, subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable plans. For jobs in the United States: As an equal opportunity employer, Gilead Sciences Inc. is committed to a diverse workforce. Employment decisions regarding recruitment and selection will be made without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, genetic information or characteristic, gender identity and expression, veteran status, or other non-job related characteristics or other prohibited grounds specified in applicable federal, state and local laws. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants who require accommodation in the job application process may contact careers@gilead.com for assistance.
